name: dramatizer
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
someone who writes a new version of a book, story, poem, etc. that can be performed: She is an acclaimed television dramatizer of the Brontës' works.
someone who behaves as if things that happen to them are more exciting, important, or dangerous than they really are: She plays a neurotic character, a constant dramatizer.
More examplesFewer examplesThe dilemma for dramatizers is obvious: they don't want to make the dictator a one-dimensional comic-book villain, but nor do they want to spend too much time sympathizing with him.Playwright Armand Gatti was a 1960s radical and dramatiser of Antonio Gramsci's prison diaries. You're such a dramatizer. Calm down!She was a dramatiser: in life and in music, and in the best possible way.
